intro: Lepismium duprei, commonly known as the dwarf flame vine, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the萝藦科 (Asclepiadaceae) family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant orange to red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Lepismium duprei thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Its unique appearance and ornamental value make it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers.
